items.sentence: Don\'t just stand there like that. Come over here and help me.
I figured you wouldn\'t want to drink coffee so late at night.
Tom thought that the amulet would protect him from werewolves.
Tom thought that the best solution was the one Mary suggested.
Tom told Mary he wanted to stay in Boston for a few more days.
Tom told Mary that he was going to show her some old pictures.
Have you already decided where you\'re going to go to college?
Let\'s eat at the restaurant across the street from the hotel.
Tom waited for Mary to say something, but she remained silent.
Tom wanted to be just friends. However, Mary wanted much more.
Tom wants to change out of his wet clothes into something dry.
Tom wants to give Mary something special on their anniversary.
Tom was a very good basketball coach, but he got fired anyway.
Tom was able to hear the music from nightclub down the street.
Tom parked in one of the empty spaces in front of the library.
Tom didn\'t have time to do everything that Mary asked him to.
Mary is still as beautiful as she was when she was a teenager.
It\'s strange that you don\'t know anything about that matter.
Tom would\'ve been here by now if his car hadn\'t broken down.
Tom\'s lost a lot of blood, but he hasn\'t lost consciousness.
Tom\'s parents didn\'t want him to become a used car salesman.
Just because he likes painting doesn\'t mean he\'s good at it.
Tom is the only one in our family who has ever studied French.
Tom is the only person I know besides me who likes to do that.
Tom knew he barely had enough time to do what he needed to do.
Tom knew that Mary was likely to not do anything he suggested.
I heard that a South American camper was eaten by an anaconda.
Tom brings his children with him to work once or twice a year.
I have two sons. One is in Boston and the other is in Chicago.
Tom came to Japan eight and a half years ago with his parents.
Tom said he wasn\'t able to do everything he\'d planned to do.
It\'s been a long time since I\'ve heard anyone use that word.
What if what Tom does isn\'t good enough? What\'ll we do then?
Tom put the plate of sandwiches on the table in front of Mary.
Tom seems to be unable to interact normally with other people.
Tom wondered whether it would be hard to find a job in Boston.
We\'ll always have to be careful not to let this happen again.
You want to grow up to be big and strong like Tom, don\'t you?
I can\'t let Tom be put in prison for something he didn\'t do.
Mary is one of the girls that Tom is interested in talking to.
When I woke us this morning, I didn\'t want to get out of bed.
Tom understood why Mary didn\'t want to go to Boston with him.
The teacher was worried by Tom\'s frequent absence from class.
What I hate most of all is having to recite texts from memory.
What makes you so sure Tom was the one who stole your bicycle?
When Mary reached the bus stop, the last bus had already left.
I\'m sorry, but I didn\'t understand what you said in English.
I\'ve just arrived. I haven\'t even unpacked my suitcases yet.
I\'m getting tired of hearing Christmas music everywhere I go.
It\'s been a long time since Tom and I\'ve done that together.
